signals.description: AAPL closed at $213.88, up 0.06% on the day. Price is wedged between narrow resistance at $216.5 and support at $202.94; mixed technical signals (RSI 57, MACD bullish crossover but still below 200-day SMA). Earnings due 31 Jul (consensus EPS $1.42) is the next catalyst. Legal overhang from multiple securities-fraud suits and AI-strategy pressure are capping upside, while $500 M rare-earth investment offers a modest tail-wind. Volume at 40.3 M is slightly below 3-month average, indicating wait-and-see sentiment.

Adobe Inc. is trading flat at $366.22 (+0.1%). Price sits below both 50-day ($393) and 200-day ($431) MAs, indicating a technical downtrend, yet RSI at 51.9 shows neutral momentum. 27 buy vs 2 sell ratings from analysts imply upside to avg target $483 (+29.8%). Recent AI-product buzz and strong FCF ($8.3 B) support sentiment, but low volume (1.2 M vs 3.9 M avg) keeps risk elevated.

AMD closed at $166.47 (+2.68%) on surging volume of 53.3 M shares—12 % above its 3-month average. The stock is riding a three-session win streak and sits just 4 % below its 52-week high of $174.05. Catalysts include: (1) a new AI-training partnership with USC ISI that could expand TAM, (2) multiple analyst upgrades this week (Erste to Buy, consensus PT raised to $150-$200), and (3) management’s reiteration that AI-chip demand may top $500 B within a few years. Technical backdrop is uniformly bullish: price is above all major SMAs (50-, 100-, 200-day), MACD triggered a fresh buy signal, and RSI at 60.8 leaves room before overbought. Social sentiment is strongly positive on Reddit and Twitter, with keywords “AI acceleration” and “data-center share gains” trending. Risk: rich 122× trailing P/E and upcoming Q2 report on Aug 5.

AMZN closed Friday at $231.44 (-0.34% on the day, +23.3% over 3 months). Volume cooled to 28.7 M vs 42.9 M Thursday. Mixed signals: technical score downgraded from Strong Buy to Buy, Jeff Bezos filed large insider sells (≈$3.5 B this week), and Canada’s Competition Bureau opened a pricing-policy probe. Earnings due 31 Jul (consensus EPS $1.33 vs $1.23 YoY). RSI ~41 suggests neither oversold nor overbought; price sits just above 50-day SMA ($214.95). Wait for post-earnings guidance before adding.

BABA closed at $120.03 (-1.0% intraday) after hitting a 2.5-month low earlier in the week. The stock is under pressure from a $1.53 B bond-issue announcement and renewed tariff fears, forming a bearish A-B-C pattern with next support around $100.55. Long-term fundamentals remain solid (14× P/E, buybacks, AI/cloud focus), but technicals flash “Sell” and options flow is defensive. Expect choppy trading between $96–$126 until macro clarity improves.

CRM closed at $267.70, down just ‑0.04% intraday but off 23.7% YTD. Mixed signals: strong Q1 earnings beat, 96% upside in analyst PT ($440 max), yet technicals remain neutral-to-sell and social chatter is cautious ahead of the Aug-20 earnings call. Volume at 5.9 M is above the 30-day average, suggesting active repositioning.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 2m ago
signals.description: CSCO closed at $68.64 (+0.51%) on 2.46 M shares, ~40 % below its 3-month average. No major news flow today; Street remains constructive (avg target $67.71, rating "Buy"), but price is already within 2 % of the 52-week high ($69.78) and momentum is flat. Hold pending fresh catalysts (earnings 12-18 Aug).

DIS closed at $120.96, down 0.8% after a volatile week. Guggenheim raised its PT to $140 on bundling upside, but retail sentiment stays neutral. Volume at 4.5 M is below the 9.7 M average; technicals show price hugging the 10-day EMA. Q3 earnings due 8 Aug keep traders sidelined.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 27m ago
signals.description: DOCU closed flat at $81.41 (+0.04%) on 1.7 M shares—well below its 90-day average. Technicals are neutral across moving averages and oscillators; no clear directional bias. News flow is light, and social sentiment is mixed. With earnings still ~5 weeks away and implied volatility subdued (IV30 rank 13%), the stock appears range-bound between $80–$82.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 2m ago
signals.description: GOOGL closed at $193.18, up 0.53% on 39.7 M shares—well above its 10-day average. Technical momentum remains strong (short- and long-term MAs aligned upward, MACD buy signal), but RSI ~76 signals overbought risk. Recent news flow is light; sentiment on social platforms is mildly positive as investors await 27 Oct earnings. Support sits at $178.53; resistance at $197–$200.

INTC plunged 9.4% Friday after mixed Q2 results and a strategic pivot that scales back foundry expansion, overshadowing a top-line beat. CEO Lip-Bu Tan scrapped German/Polish plants and slowed Ohio construction, spooking investors about Intel’s manufacturing roadmap. Volume spiked to 244 M shares—triple the norm—while technicals flipped bearish with 26 of 26 indicators flashing SELL. Social sentiment is very negative, though insiders have been net buyers. Near-term pain likely; wait for support test around $20.

JPM closed at $298.62 Friday, up 0.70% on the day and +4.1% over the past two weeks. Volume jumped 606 k shares to 5.9 M, confirming the up-move. Technicals remain constructive—price sits above both 50-day ($241) and 200-day ($234) MAs, though RSI at 63 is nearing overbought. Street sentiment is upbeat: 14 Buy vs 1 Sell rating, median target $258-$330. Next catalyst is Q3 earnings 14 Oct.

META closed Friday at $712.68 (-0.30% on the day, ‑1.7% WoW). Volume fell to 8.2 M shares vs 10.9 M Thursday, indicating waning momentum. Technicals are mixed: price sits just above the 50-day SMA ($689) but below the 21-day ($717) and faces resistance at $726. Earnings due Wednesday (cons. EPS $5.80) could catalyze a ±3.5% move. News sentiment is cautiously bullish, with AI product roll-outs and ad-revenue optimism offset by regulatory headlines. Social chatter is net positive but fear-greed index at 39 (Fear) keeps retail cautious. Maintain HOLD into earnings.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 3h ago
signals.description: MSFT closed Friday at $498.84, up 1.6 % for the week and hovering just below its all-time high of $514.64 set on 18 Jul. Volume has been above-average (≈14 M shares) ahead of Wednesday’s FQ4 earnings (consensus EPS $3.35 vs $2.95 YoY). News flow is light—main items are a patched SharePoint hijack (no price impact) and continued AI-cap-ex momentum. Social sentiment is mildly positive, but implied volatility is compressed, suggesting a wait-and-see stance into the print.

NFLX closed at $1,180.49, down only ‑0.02% after a choppy week. Q2 revenue beat ($11.12B, +13.7% y/y) and EPS surge (+47%) are offset by mixed analyst moves: two downgrades (Phillip to Sell, price-target-cut to $950) vs. multiple PT hikes to $1,400-$1,500 range. Technicals sit neutral—price is 1% below 10-DMA and 7% off the $1,341 high, while volume (2.6 M) is below the 4 M average. Options flow is light, and social sentiment is mildly positive on ad-tier growth but cautious on competition. Fair value models flag a 212% premium to Morningstar’s $828 FV. Risk/reward looks balanced near-term.

NVDA closed at $173.50 (-0.14%) after hitting an intraday high of $174.72. Short-term technical signals remain positive despite the minor pullback; volume contracted to 122 M shares, which is often constructive after a run-up. 43/48 analysts rate it a Buy with an average 12-month target of $181.27. AI demand narrative intact, but insiders have been net sellers and the stock is near resistance, so risk/reward is less favorable for intraday traders.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 3m ago
signals.description: ORCL closed at $241.90 on Jul 23 (+1.59%). Mixed technical signals: MACD sell crossover but long-term SMA support at $214.74; RSI 64.4 suggests room before overbought. Volume fell 4M shares on the gain, hinting at short-term caution. 94 analysts cover the stock with consensus 18% upside target $178–$246. Insiders net-buying last 100 trades (31.7 M bought vs 26.7 M sold).

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 20m ago
signals.description: PINS opened at 36.46 and is trading up 2.9 % to 37.11 on 10.8 M shares—well above the 90-day average—after a strong pre-market pop to 38.84. Technical trend is now “Uptrend” with price above key moving averages. Implied volatility remains elevated (60 % IV30, 70 % rank) ahead of the 7-Aug earnings release, but option flow is skewed bullish. No material negative news; only routine insider selling. Momentum and sentiment favor continued strength into earnings.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 2m ago
signals.description: PayPal closed at $77.98, up 1.51 % on 6.8 M shares ahead of Wednesday’s Q2 report. Technicals are bullish across all major MAs, but options flow is mixed and sentiment is cautious into earnings. No major news today; focus is entirely on guidance.

ROKU closed Friday at $93.29, up 2.4% on the week but still well off its February highs. Q1 showed narrowing losses (-$27M vs ‑$51M YoY) and positive FCF, though ARPU is no longer disclosed. Valuation compressed to 2.1× sales, pricing it like a value stock. Street expects Q2 results on 7/31; Benchmark reiterated Buy ahead of print. Social sentiment is cautiously optimistic, but options flow shows elevated put activity. Hold pending earnings clarity.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 2m ago
signals.description: SHOP closed at $125.38, up 2.59% on heavy 8.5 M volume, breaking above its 200-day SMA. 54 analysts are 65% Buy/35% Hold with median PT $119. Social sentiment is very positive ahead of Aug-6 earnings, driven by strong Q2 merchant growth reports.

Snap closed at $9.11, down 2.4% intraday. Recent upgrades (Bernstein & Morgan Stanley raising PT to $10 and $8.50) and heavy options flow (≈200 k contracts Friday) hint at cautious optimism ahead of the 7/31 earnings. However, YTD ‑19% and bearish technical backdrop (price below 50- & 200-day SMA) keep risk/reward balanced.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 2h ago
signals.description: Block (SQ) closed at $86.17, down 4.47% on the session and ‑6.28% over the past month. Volume remains light and sentiment on social channels is mixed; analysts cite macro headwinds for fintech rather than company-specific issues. With no major catalysts until next earnings, the near-term risk/reward appears balanced.

Twitter (TWTR) is no longer actively traded after Elon Musk’s 2022 take-private deal at $54.70; shares remain structurally pegged near $53.70 with zero volume. No fresh corporate news or analyst coverage exists, and social chatter is muted. Treat as delisted/halted—no actionable trade setup.

signals.timestamp: the time the news is from 30m ago
signals.description: UBER closed at $90.59, down 0.6 % intraday amid mixed sentiment. 9.1 M shares traded—well below the 21.3 M average—while technicals sit neutral (RSI 38.4). Headlines focus on upcoming Aug-6 earnings and cautious analyst PT trims. Social chatter is mildly negative on regulatory risk in Europe.
Visa（V）今日平开，股价微跌0.2%，报$304.85。期权市场显示305行权价看跌期权隐含波动率飙升至3368%，暗示短期波动预期极高，但成交量为零，情绪偏谨慎。技术图形出现“Falling Three Methods”短期看跌形态，叠加社交媒体情绪中性略偏负面，短线缺乏明确方向，建议观望。
Zoom closed at $75.63 (-0.55% intraday). 3% revenue growth expected for FY26; 69 analysts have a median $81 target (7% upside). Social chatter mixed—AI features praised but growth concerns linger.

Tesla Faces Production Challenges in China Amid Supply Chain Issues
NVIDIA Announces New AI Chip Architecture
